subject: Personal Finance
title: Regulation After Disaster
description: A short lesson to help you apply Regulation After Disaster.

hook.text: Every major financial law was born from a crisis. We only fix the barn door after the horse escapes.

buildup.text: The SEC was created after 1929. FDIC after bank runs. Dodd-Frank after 2008. Crisis drives reform.

discovery.text: Regulations work â€” for a while. Bank failures dropped to near zero after FDIC insurance.

twist.text: Then industries lobby to weaken rules. Regulations erode until the next crisis proves they were necessary.

climax.text: The cycle of crisis, regulation, complacency, and deregulation has repeated for over 300 years.

punchline.text: We regulate after disaster, then forget why.

quiz.question: What pattern do financial regulations follow?
options: Regulations are never changed once enacted
